documentation.text:
BeneficiaryRegistry links claim documents and approval states.
 - Docs are stored off-chain (IPFS/Arweave), with on-chain hashes recorded.
 - A claim requires both: Jury approved AND a government official approval.
Soulbound NFT for government officials. Non-transferable, immutable metadata.

Minimal staking + voting registry for jury selection.
 - Jurors stake native token to join pool
 - Random selection handled off-chain or via VRF-like adapter (out of scope for MVP)
 - Voting recorded per claimId; simple majority with quorum
 - Slashing entry points provided (governance callable)
Minimal ERC20 for testing stablecoin flows.

MonadRelief: Real-time micro-donations for disaster relief on Monad L1
 - Micro-donations starting at $0.01-equivalent (handled via stablecoin decimals)
 - Instant distribution to verified beneficiaries
 - Full on-chain transparency through events and mappings

Donation contract that routes funds only to approved beneficiaries
 (approved by both government SBT holder and jury consensus).
